svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 13, 2024" date: "2024-01-12"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Goerli shadow fork 2 : stable network with blob spamming using Goerli client releases
Fork choice filter change: to be included in Deneb Consensus layer priorities: discuss
next call, proposed Electra EIPs & PeerDAS
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Goerli shadow fork 2 : stable network with blob spamming using Goerli client releases
* Fork choice filter change: to be included in Deneb
Fork choice filter change: to be included in Deneb
* Consensus layer priorities: discuss next call, proposed Electra EIPs & PeerDAS
Consensus layer priorities: discuss next call, proposed Electra EIPs & PeerDAS
* Dencun interop testing call video
Dencun interop testing call video
* Ephemery testnet upgrades to Dencun January 18
Ephemery testnet upgrades to Dencun January 18
* Goerli testnet upgrades to Dencun January 17 Bug bounty doubled for Dencun specific
vulnerabilities, up to $500k
Goerli testnet upgrades to Dencun January 17
* Bug bounty doubled for Dencun specific vulnerabilities, up to $500k
Client releases for Goerli testnet Dencun upgrade
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.6.0-rc.0 : pre-release Lodestar v1.14.0-rc.2 :
pre-release Nimbus v24.1.1 Prysm v4.2.0 Teku v24.1.0
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v4.6.0-rc.0 : pre-release
Lighthouse v4.6.0-rc.0 : pre-release
* Lodestar v1.14.0-rc.2 : pre-release
Lodestar v1.14.0-rc.2 : pre-release
* Nimbus v24.1.1
Nimbus v24.1.1
* Prysm v4.2.0
Prysm v4.2.0
* Teku v24.1.0
Teku v24.1.0
* Execution layer: Besu v24.1.0 Erigon v2.56.2 Geth v1.13.10 Nethermind v1.25.0 : OP
Stack Canyon upgrade support Reth v0.1.0-alpha.14
Execution layer:
* Besu v24.1.0
Besu v24.1.0
* Erigon v2.56.2
Erigon v2.56.2
Geth v1.13.10
* Nethermind v1.25.0 : OP Stack Canyon upgrade support
Nethermind v1.25.0 : OP Stack Canyon upgrade support
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha.14
Reth v0.1.0-alpha.14
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold Social action options to tackle
a concentrated actor
🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Social action options to tackle a concentrated actor
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 84% supermajority,
could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm 41%, any client bug over
33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth 84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth 84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm 41%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 41%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* Increasing gas limit debate: Péter Szilágyi: need monitoring & metrics before making
a change Marius van der Wijden: risks include missed block rate, state size, history
size, sync times & client diversity Ansgar Dietrichs: EIP4844 is equivalent of ~11M
additional gas Dankrad Feist: wait until after Dencun , then also increase calldata
cost & number of blobs Vitalik: modest increase is reasonable
Increasing gas limit debate:
* Péter Szilágyi: need monitoring & metrics before making a change
Péter Szilágyi: need monitoring & metrics before making a change
* Marius van der Wijden: risks include missed block rate, state size, history size,
sync times & client diversity
Marius van der Wijden: risks include missed block rate, state size, history size, sync
times & client diversity
* Ansgar Dietrichs: EIP4844 is equivalent of ~11M additional gas
Ansgar Dietrichs: EIP4844 is equivalent of ~11M additional gas
* Dankrad Feist: wait until after Dencun , then also increase calldata cost & number of
blobs
Dankrad Feist: wait until after Dencun , then also increase calldata cost & number of
* Vitalik: modest increase is reasonable
Vitalik: modest increase is reasonable
* Besu halted on mainnet January 6, ~70% of Besu nodes impacted, hot fixed
Besu halted on mainnet January 6, ~70% of Besu nodes impacted, hot fixed
* Reth state & history growth dashboard
Reth state & history growth dashboard
* Nethermind State Database experimental approaches: Paprika, Path-Based Storage &
Halfpath
Nethermind State Database experimental approaches: Paprika, Path-Based Storage &
* Explainers: EIP7002 (execution layer triggerable exits) & EIP7251 (increase max
effective balance)
Explainers: EIP7002 (execution layer triggerable exits) & EIP7251 (increase max
Research
* EF Research team AMA , discussions include: EIP4844 data publishing without scaling,
composability across rollups, Lido, security budget, capping signatures to 8192 per
slot, gas limit increase, native (enshrined) rollups, EigenLayer, MEV burn & EIP7251
(increase max effective balance)
EF Research team AMA , discussions include: EIP4844 data publishing without scaling,
* Staking economics: issuance impact on staking equilibrium & reward curve options
Staking economics: issuance impact on staking equilibrium & reward curve options
MEV
* Proposals for relay incentivization : low-latency relay mesh network and enshrining
missed slot penalty on proposers
Layer 2
* OP Stack Canyon upgrade live on Superchain mainnets, adds Shappella support
(including PUSH0), reduces rate of basefee change & adds Create2Deployer
OP Stack Canyon upgrade live on Superchain mainnets, adds Shappella support (including
PUSH0), reduces rate of basefee change & adds Create2Deployer
* RollCall (L2 standards) video & notes : RIP7212 (R1 precompile) made final, EIP7587
(reserve RIP precompile addresses) discussion and RIP working groups (precompiles,
EIP4844 testing & fee markets)
RollCall (L2 standards) video & notes : RIP7212 (R1 precompile) made final, EIP7587
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs EIP7591 : BLS signed transactions EIP7592 : Precompile for Falcon signature
verification EIP7594 : PeerDAS (peer data availability sampling)
EIPs
* EIP7591 : BLS signed transactions
EIP7591 : BLS signed transactions
* EIP7592 : Precompile for Falcon signature verification
EIP7592 : Precompile for Falcon signature verification
* EIP7594 : PeerDAS (peer data availability sampling)
EIP7594 : PeerDAS (peer data availability sampling)
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7589 : Semi-fungible token roles ERC7590 : ERC20 holder
extension for NFTs ERC7593 : NFT synthetic evidence
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7589 : Semi-fungible token roles
ERC7589 : Semi-fungible token roles
* ERC7590 : ERC20 holder extension for NFTs
ERC7590 : ERC20 holder extension for NFTs
* ERC7593 : NFT synthetic evidence
ERC7593 : NFT synthetic evidence
Stuff for developers
* Remix v0.40.0 : Ape framework Vyper compiler, Uniswap v4 templates & Circom v2.1.6
Remix v0.40.0 : Ape framework Vyper compiler, Uniswap v4 templates & Circom v2.1.6
* GasliteNFT (ERC721 base contract): extends ERC721A with Ownable2Step & MerkeProofLib
GasliteNFT (ERC721 base contract): extends ERC721A with Ownable2Step & MerkeProofLib
* RareSkills: Compound v3 explainer
RareSkills: Compound v3 explainer
* Equivalence checking with Halmos
Equivalence checking with Halmos
* Evm-inspectors : Revm Inspectors for Parity & Geth style traces and JS Inspector
Evm-inspectors : Revm Inspectors for Parity & Geth style traces and JS Inspector
* Wevm Vocs : React-based static documentation generator, content in Markdown or MDX
Wevm Vocs : React-based static documentation generator, content in Markdown or MDX
Security
* Wise Lending ~177 ETH exploit via precision issue
Wise Lending ~177 ETH exploit via precision issue
* Behind the scenes of Euler March 2023 exploit & fund recovery
Behind the scenes of Euler March 2023 exploit & fund recovery
Ecosystem
* Optimism’s RetroPGF round 3 results , 30M OP allocated to 501 builders & creators
Enterprise
* Unicef Rwanda using staking to fund school internet connectivity
Unicef Rwanda using staking to fund school internet connectivity
* X (Twitter) removed NFT profile picture support
X (Twitter) removed NFT profile picture support
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 9.2 to 483.5 gwei, with 26.2 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 21.9 gwei 3.2k ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 9.2 to 483.5 gwei, with 26.2 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 21.9 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 21.9 gwei
* 3.2k ETH net burn this week
3.2k ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD : $2,185 - $2,698, currently $2,497
ETHUSD : $2,185 - $2,698, currently $2,497
* ETHBTC : currently 0.06 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.06 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* USDC & EURC v2.2 upgrade complete: reduces gas costs & supports ERC1271
USDC & EURC v2.2 upgrade complete: reduces gas costs & supports ERC1271
* OpenSea email onboarding : create non-custodial wallet via email address using Privy
OpenSea email onboarding : create non-custodial wallet via email address using Privy
* Simon de la Rouviere See You There : 1 of 1 NFT, records holders over 5 years
Simon de la Rouviere See You There : 1 of 1 NFT, records holders over 5 years
* Speedtracer (daily mini game) live on Base, trace a race track & mint highest score
Speedtracer (daily mini game) live on Base, trace a race track & mint highest score
Job Listings
* Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC approves BTC ETFs Commissioner Peirce : “squandered a decade of opportunities”
SEC Twitter account was compromised via a phone number without 2FA
SEC approves BTC ETFs
* Commissioner Peirce : “squandered a decade of opportunities”
Commissioner Peirce : “squandered a decade of opportunities”
* SEC Twitter account was compromised via a phone number without 2FA
* Circle filed for IPO
Circle filed for IPO
* New York DFS settles with Genesis for compliance failures, $8M penalty & cease
operations in the state
New York DFS settles with Genesis for compliance failures, $8M penalty & cease
General
* Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop videos
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-january-13-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jan 15 – EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
Jan 15 – EF’s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
* Jan 17 – Goerli testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 231680, livestream
Jan 17 – Goerli testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 231680, livestream
* Jan 30 – Sepolia testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 132608 (assuming no issues)
Jan 30 – Sepolia testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 132608 (assuming no issues)
* Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
* Feb 3 – Ethereum Lima Day
Feb 3 – Ethereum Lima Day
* Feb 7 – Holešky testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 29696 (assuming no issues)
Feb 7 – Holešky testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 29696 (assuming no issues)
* Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
* Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
* Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London hackathon
Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London hackathon

Mar 19-21 – ETH Canal (Panama City, Panamá) conference & hackathon
* Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
* Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference
Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference

Mar 29-31 – ETH Seoul conference
* Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon
Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon

Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference
* Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon
May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon

May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
* May 24-26 – ETHBerlin
May 24-26 – ETHBerlin
* May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference

May 31-Jun 2 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* Jun 3-5 – ETH Belgrade conference
Jun 3-5 – ETH Belgrade conference
* Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
* Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
* Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
